Eureka lemons are a popular choice for lemonade, and they're widely available.

Now, about outdoor games and activities for your family gathering... I've got some fantastic ideas for you!

1. **Scavenger Hunt**: Create a list of items that can be found in nature, such as leaves, rocks, feathers, or specific types of flowers. Divide the family into teams and see who can find everything on the list first.
2. **Lawn Games**: Bring along a few lawn games like a frisbee, a deck of cards, or a badminton set. You can also set up a mini obstacle course using items like cones, chairs, or blankets.
3. **Nature Walk**: Take a leisurely walk around the park or picnic area and observe the surroundings. Encourage everyone to take photos or collect interesting items they find along the way.
4. **Picnic Bingo**: Create bingo cards with items commonly found in nature, like birds, clouds, or flowers. Give each person a card and see who can mark off all their items first.
5. **Storytelling**: Gather everyone around for a fun storytelling session. You can take turns telling stories, sharing memories, or making up new tales together.
6. **Outdoor Art**: Bring along some sidewalk chalk, bubbles, or sidewalk paint, and let the kids (and adults!) get creative. You can draw games, patterns, or create art together.
7. **Nature Journaling**: Encourage everyone to bring a notebook and pencil to record their observations, draw pictures, or write poetry inspired by nature.
8. **Frisbee Golf**: Set up a mini frisbee golf course using natural obstacles like trees, rocks, or hills. See who can complete the course with the fewest throws.
9. **Water Games**: If the picnic area has a water source nearby, consider bringing along water balloons, a water gun, or a small pool for a fun water-based activity.
10. **Photography Contest**: Encourage everyone to take photos of the scenery, each other, or interesting things they find. You can even have a mini contest to see who takes the best photo.

Remember to keep the activities simple, safe, and enjoyable for everyone. The goal is to have fun and spend quality time together as a family!

I hope these ideas help make your picnic a memorable and enjoyable experience!
